alert.note: Alert for Mercer (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 4:31PM EDT until July 15 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of New Jersey...and southeast Pennsylvania... including the following counties...in New Jersey...Hunterdon and Mercer. In southeast Pennsylvania...Bucks. * WHEN...Until 630 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 429 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... New Hope, Ivyland, Stockton, Richboro, Lambertville, and Newtown Grant. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away from flooded creeks and streams. Do not drive across the road if water is flowing over it.
